page.title: 08Smarden West - Transport
page.content: As with so many country villages, transport can be a problem for those without a car. As the land is flat bicycles are popular with all ages for travelling around the village or getting to Headcorn, a reasonable shopping centre. The railway station at Headcorn is popular with people living in the country and commuting to London for work. Heavy lorries are a great problem in the country lanes, ploughing up verges and destroying the surface of roads not built to bear such weights. The main culprits are 38 tonne bulk carriers taking sand, etc. also grain carriers and 40' TIR trailers from the continent bringing food etc. to the processing plants at Marley Farm. This is not just a local problem and many parts of the county are suffering from overlarge and overweight vehicles on narrow roads.
